gr.forth.ics.swkm.model2.labels
Interface LabelManager

All Known Implementing Classes:
LabelManagers.NonIncrementalMainMemoryManager
public interface LabelManager

A manager of labeling structures, which has the responsibility of providing labeling services to a Model.

This interface also defines triple event callbacks (tripleAdded(Triple), tripleDeleted(Triple))

Author:
Andreou Dimitris, email: jim.andreou (at) gmail (dot) com

Method Summary
 boolean areLabelsAvailable()
          Provides a hint whether a subsequent call to isFirstAncestorOfSecond(Resource, Resource) will be fast.
 Model getTargetModel()
          Returns the model that this LabelManager provides labeling services for.
 boolean isFirstAncestorOfSecond(Resource maybeAncestor, Resource maybeDescendant)
          Returns true if the first resource is an ancestor of the second resource (or if they are the same) or false otherwise, according to the labels.
 void tripleAdded(Triple triple)
          Notifies this LabelManager that a new triple is added to this LabelManager provides services for the model (updates to the triple named graphs are irrelevant).
 void tripleDeleted(Triple triple)
          Notifies this LabelManager that a triple is deleted from the model this LabelManager provides services for (updates to the triple named graphs are irrelevant).

          Ensures that the labels are consistent with the model that this LabelManager provides services for.
 

Method Detail

tripleAdded

void tripleAdded(Triple triple)
Notifies this LabelManager that a new triple is added to this LabelManager provides services for the model (updates to the triple named graphs are irrelevant).

Parameters:
triple - the triple that was added to the model this LabelManager provides services for

tripleDeleted

void tripleDeleted(Triple triple)
Notifies this LabelManager that a triple is deleted from the model this LabelManager provides services for (updates to the triple named graphs are irrelevant).

Parameters:
triple - the triple that was deleted from the model this LabelManager provides services for

updateLabels

void updateLabels(PredefinedLabels predefinedLabels)
Ensures that the labels are consistent with the model that this LabelManager provides services for. This may need recalculating all indexes from scratch, updating missing labels, or even nothing if this implementation incrementally maintains its labels based on the triple additions/deletions notifications.

The caller may indicate predefined labels for any model's schema resource by providing a PredefinedLabels implementation. It is not guaranteed that predefined labels will always be respected.

Parameters:
predefinedLabels - a source of predefined labels, that must be respected by the underlying labeling algorithm. If predefinedLabels is null, it will be ignored

isFirstAncestorOfSecond

boolean isFirstAncestorOfSecond(Resource maybeAncestor,
                                Resource maybeDescendant)
Returns true if the first resource is an ancestor of the second resource (or if they are the same) or false otherwise, according to the labels.

Parameters:
maybeAncestor - the first resource, which is tested whether it is an ancestor of the second according to the labels
maybeDescendant - the second resource, which is tested whether it is a descendant of the first according to the labels
Returns:
true if the first resource is an ancestor of the second resource, false otherwise

areLabelsAvailable

boolean areLabelsAvailable()
Provides a hint whether a subsequent call to isFirstAncestorOfSecond(Resource, Resource) will be fast.

Returns:
true if labels are available (and subsequent calls to isFirstAncestorOfSecond(Resource, Resource) will be fast), or false otherwise.

getTargetModel

Model getTargetModel()
Returns the model that this LabelManager provides labeling services for.

Returns:
the model that this LabelManager provides labeling services for
